overview_of_class:
Instruction in experimental techniques of modern organic chemistry emphasizing chemical separations, spectroscopic characterization, and reactions of alkanes, alkenes, alkyl halides, alcohols, carbonyls, esters, and aromatic compounds.

Chemistry 230-2 is the laboratory course associated with Chemistry 210-2.
name: Organic Chemistry Lab I
title: WCAS CHEM 230-2-33 Organic Chemistry Lab I
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 210-2.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Instruction in experimental techniques of modern organic chemistry emphasizing chemical separations, spectroscopic characterization, and reactions of alkanes, alkenes, alkyl halides, alcohols, carbonyls, esters, and aromatic compounds.

Chemistry 230-2 is the laboratory course associated with Chemistry 210-2.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in Chemistry 210-1.

Students enrolled in this course MUST also enroll in the associated lecture course, Chem 210-2.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. Turning Technologies Model QT or NXT "Clicker" and associated license ($58.65 new; $44.00 used)***

2. 100% Cotton Laboratory Coat ($45)

3. Approved Laboratory Goggles or Safety Glasses ($10)

Items 2 and 3 will be sold during the first week of classes; sales details TBA

***Price as listed at Northwestern Norris Bookstore on 4/4/17. Materials may be available from other vendors at lower prices.

subject: CHEM
